{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chromosomal mapping is the process of locating genes on a chromosome. Inheritance testing is used to determine whether a person is a carrier of a genetic disorder. Karyotyping, on the other hand, is the process of pairing and ordering all the chromosomes of an organism, thus providing a genome-wide snapshot of an individual's chromosomes.
